On december 17, 2016
jump792

I has an idea. As we know mush players get full eating anything, and must wait 4 cycles before eating anything else. This had lead to the creation of the Food Test, which is a controversial method to find out if someone is human or not (I say human because rule wise you can't use it to label someone as mush, but if someone does perform it, they are clearly a human.). My suggestion is to make it so that people who are mush can eat 4 times a day, avoiding the satisfaction and cycles altogether. This would make it so people can't just willy nilly use a food test one someone as the mush can also eat twice in one cycle. This would also make it so mush have a new strategy: eating 4 of whatever in a day to remove it from the humans. With that, it would both make it so the food test is harder to perform unless you have a lot of something that doesn't give satisfaction (coffee and jumpkins) as well as make it so the mush have another method of offense by scarfing down food (it will likely be obvious if people count the rations, so it is also a risky idea too).
On december 18, 2016
Aceb
jump792I has an idea. As we know mush players get full eating anything, and must wait 4 cycles before eating anything else. This had lead to the creation of the Food Test, which is a controversial method to find out if someone is human or not (I say human because rule wise you can't use it to label someone as mush, but if someone does perform it, they are clearly a human.). My suggestion is to make it so that people who are mush can eat 4 times a day, avoiding the satisfaction and cycles altogether. This would make it so people can't just willy nilly use a food test one someone as the mush can also eat twice in one cycle. This would also make it so mush have a new strategy: eating 4 of whatever in a day to remove it from the humans. With that, it would both make it so the food test is harder to perform unless you have a lot of something that doesn't give satisfaction (coffee and jumpkins) as well as make it so the mush have another method of offense by scarfing down food (it will likely be obvious if people count the rations, so it is also a risky idea too).

I'm not that old player, but I remember old players speaking about how mush could eat as much as they wished and that putted humans in big disadvantage. Also, What You offer here, is making it harder to make a foodtest but doesn't prevent it.

Also I say no to that idea. We already have people openly refusing to do such thing and forcing people is prohibited.
On december 18, 2016
jump792
Aceb

I'm not that old player, but I remember old players speaking about how mush could eat as much as they wished and that putted humans in big disadvantage. Also, What You offer here, is making it harder to make a foodtest but doesn't prevent it.

Also I say no to that idea. We already have people openly refusing to do such thing and forcing people is prohibited.

This wasn't made to flat out prevent it, as that is near to impossible (EDIT: unless it's changed to mush can eat at all times, then humans are more or less screwed then). This does make to very hard to perform a food test unless you are willing to dispense a few klix to prove your humanity (or if they get things that give 0 satisfaction).
As for the food tests, the problem is that it subtle happens more often then you may think. I'm not saying that people are forcing others to eat, but rather some players go out of their way to prove they're human.
People eating for research can also be using it as an excuse. One can't prove that (but it's more likely when someone shouts to the top of their lungs that they are human because of this.). I have had it occur on some of my ships, so that's kind of why I think this would be a good idea.
On december 18, 2016
Aceb

Not all double-eats are straight-forward planned human reveal. Some people double-eats and don't announce it, because they simply needed it. I can agree some players rush to prove they're humans and stuff, but it's double-edged sword, smart mush can use it against them or the crew.

Usually, I don't care if someone does the food test. If they do, I only assume, they cannot be alpha and that's all.

It's my own experience but I think there's a lot more players that discourage to do food-tests and doesn't do them themselfs, but the problem is, that people will always more notice those who does.

Also, possible to be un-lucky with those.
On december 18, 2016
jump792
Aceb

Not all double-eats are straight-forward planned human reveal. Some people double-eats and don't announce it, because they simply needed it. I can agree some players rush to prove they're humans and stuff, but it's double-edged sword, smart mush can use it against them or the crew.

Usually, I don't care if someone does the food test. If they do, I only assume, they cannot be alpha and that's all.

It's my own experience but I think there's a lot more players that discourage to do food-tests and doesn't do them themselfs, but the problem is, that people will always more notice those who does.

Also, possible to be un-lucky with those.

How can a mush use that against the crew? Make them a dedicated target or something? Even then people like that who get proven are usually harder to get to. I am aware of the fact that yes, not everyone who double eats is going out of their way to prove they're humans, but someone can and will point this out.
As for not caring if someone does that, that is a big thing to be clearly not alpha mush! If the list appears, and there are several names, if anyone double ate they are striked right off the list of being alpha mush which makes the list all the more smaller. Then there's the fact that this person is easily not mush because of this simple thing they did. It's not luck, not something that took time or study, no just eating a double serving is all they did. The point of this is make it so people who do research and people who deliberately try to prove themselves don't. Ruins the whole studying someones anything aspect.
As for unlucky...not gonna lie, I don't know what you mean by that

On december 19, 2016
sperbi

In past actually many people suggested a system how to do something against easy self comfirming via food test, which is showing a big interest in community to do something against it.
I remember an idea, which was something like to introduce a new mush skill with which it is possible to eat multiple stuff like a human, a nice idea, because even if you have not the skill slot as mush for it, anyone confirming themselves may have used that skill and making the food test as a whole not reliable anymore.

Actually they just have to make food consuming system of mushes equal to the one of humans then and not show starving status nor get health loss from starving.
The argument of too high food destruction because of it seems strange to me, as you would probably see the effects (or rather no effects) if a mush is consuming too much stuff but not using the energy and would lead quickly to their downfall.

But it may also be the mush devs did it intentionally for some reasons I personally would not find important enough, but are still there (like a person made a huge mistake and takes the possibility to prove just for avoiding to get killed for it).

So far I don't do any food tests, not even voluntary ones to keep the mush mystery a mystery, which is solvable rather from detective work and not abusing easy mechanics and I am not alone with that. So the current way to do about this, as long as nothing gets fixed here is just to keep away from food tests personally and hope that the majority of other people will do the same too.
And asl long as it only happens in minor instances that someone is voluntarily food testing, it is not such a big problem.
Because as aceb mentioned, if mush is able to convert such a confirmed human, the reward is even higher for the mush team then.
On december 19, 2016
sperbi

little follow up, but which should not change my conclusion: food tests also spoils mush attempts of manipulation to let the crew kill themselves, if every human who is very suspicious would just prove themselves.

On january 23, 2019
Dzanek

Although the game is not gonna be updated, I'd like to share what changes I would like to be performed if it was possible.

  • Oxygen shouldn't be consumed with constant amount.
    • ~640 units of oxygen, consumed 2 units per crewmember.
      • Sleeping crewmembers consume 1 oxygen less.
      • Crewmembers on expedition have their own oxygen. They don't consume any oxygen from tanks during expedition.
        • If the planet has no oxygen, crewmembers have to fill their spacesuit with a unit of oxygen before launching. Crewmembers with no oxygen in their spacesuits stay in Icarus.
          • The oxygen in spacesuit isn't consumed if the expedition is finished in the same cycle when launched.
      • Fire consume a unit of oxygen per room on fire.
        • The fire is put out if there's no oxygen in tanks.
          • If a room on fire has an oxygen capsule in shelving-unit, the fire consumes the capsule instead of being put out.
    • Broken oxygen tanks cause oxygen to be consumed twice/thrice as much respectively.
    • If there's no oxygen in tanks during cycle change, crewmembers with no oxygen capsules in their inventory get "Asphyxia" status.
      • If the same thing happens in another cycle change, crewmembers with "Asphyxia" status will die due to lack of oxygen.
      • Crewmembers lose "Asphyxia" status during day change.
      • With "Asphyxia" status there's a chance to get an internal injury or disorder.
    • If there's not enough oxygen in tanks during cycle change for everyone to consume, only a part of crewmembers/fire are affected.
      • Fire has the first priority to consume oxygen, then crewmembers sleeping. Crewmembers standing on board are the last.
        • If only a part of group gets to consume the last oxygen, it goes randomly who consumes the oxygen.
  • Navigation should be more realistic.
    • If Daedalus moves, not all the scanned planets are completely lost.
      • If Daedalus moves parallel to the direction of a planet, the fuel required to go to the planet is decreased/increased properly.
        • If the distance from a planet exceeds 9 units of fuel, the planet is lost.
      • If Daedalus moves perpendicular to the direction of a planet, there's Y*11% chance that the planet is lost, where Y is a distance from the place where the planet was scanned.
    • While running away from attackers, the next assault will happen depending how much fuel you put to run away.
  • Balance Mush play, humans shouldn't be confirmed so easily, remove metagaming where confirmed humans have more privileges than others.
    • Illnesses can't be healed. Only pills, alien fruits and cycle changes.
    • Curing a disorder is visible to the patient and the shrink who cures them.
      • Failed attempts don't show in logs.
    • Interracting with camera using Nimble Fingers won't highlight its logs red.
    • Creating a 4lvl Mush skill that for 1 AP removes "Full Stomach" status.
    • The chance to sabotage an equipment has increased ~2/3 times, but the chance decreases with each the next object in the same cycle.
      • Saboteur skill removes the penalty instead of doubling.
    • Nightmarish has a cost of 1 AP and is a private action.
    • Ninja anonymous attacks are visible to the victim and the attacker.
      • Final blow is visible for everybody.
    • Pyromaniac skill has a cost of 3 AP and requires a fuel capsule to be used.
    • Bacteriophiliac is a private action.
    • Vomitting leaves a secret log, everybody in the room becomes dirty when the event occurs.
  • Make some human skills worth picking and let the player have some dilemna what to choose.
    • Panic skill works if more than half of people in the room are Mush, not when at least half of crew is Mush.
    • Opportunist skill doesn't give AP. If a person with a title becomes unable to hold the title and Opportunist doesn't have any title, the Opportunist will gain the title.
      • Opportunist won't give away the title until becoming unable to hold the title, except for Politician's Coup, if Opportunist is not a Politician.
      • If multiple titles are given away in the same cycle and the Opportunist doesn't get any in normal selection, the Opportunist will become the Commander. If Commander title is not given away, the Opportunist will become NERON Administrator.
      • Opportunist skill works for Mush.
    • Cold Blooded skill rework.
      • Gives 1 AP for every hunter shot.
      • Gives 2 AP for every crewmember killed.
      • Gives 3 AP for every won fight event during expedition.
